ground_truth: He talks to the offscreen Mickey as he walks. Dr. Abel moves offscreen in the second examining room. The camera stays focused on the doorway to this room as the doctor and Mickey talk offscreen. Dr. Abel briefly passes by the doorway. Looking preoccupied, Dr. Abel walks back into the consultation room, holding Mickey's open file. He strides over to his desk, revealing a frightened Mickey, sitting in a chair opposite it. Still standing, the doctor leans over the desk, his back to the camera, and makes a few notes in the file. Dr. Abel chuckles as he closes Mickey's file and straightens up. The camera looks past his back and shoulders to the anxious Mickey. Dr. Abel lays his pen across Mickey's closed file. He walks around his desk and sits on its edge close to Mickey. Mickey stands in a telephone booth on a corner near Dr. Abel's office; he talks on the phone. It is raining. A man and a woman holding an umbrella pass by; traffic moves across a nearby intersection. The film cuts to Dr. Wilkes, on the telephone at his end. He is in his office; he leans back in his chair, dangling his stethoscope as he speaks. Behind him, a chest X-ray is mounted on a light panel. The movie cuts back and forth between Mickey in his phone booth asking questions and Dr. Wilkes in his office answering them. Gail, wearing her glasses, stands behind a crowded but well-ordered desk. Two assistants, a man and a woman, stand around her. The assistants walk off. As they leave, Gail calls out after them. The telephone starts to ring, Gail pauses, looking offscreen. She takes off her glasses and squints. The film cuts to Mickey, who is pacing and wringing his hands. He walks over to Gail. He starts to pant, looking worriedly around the room. He continues to wring his hands as Gail stares at him, concerned. She sits down and picks up the phone. Gail hangs up the phone. He pants and begins to pace around the room. The camera follows him as he walks away from Gail. Mickey sighs. Mickey begins pacing around the room again. He wrings his hands and blows on them. An abstract painting on a wall fills the screen. Light laughter is heard, as well as the sophisticated music; offscreen brunch guests chatter indistinctly. Holly walks onto the screen in front of the painting. She holds an almost empty tray of hors d'oeuvres; she wears a uniform. One of the men, murmuring his thanks, takes a last shrimp puff as Holly passes. Holly finally makes her way into the cluttered loft kitchen. Her tray is empty.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He converses with the offscreen Mickey as he strolls. Dr. Abel relocates offscreen in the second examination chamber. The camera remains concentrated on the entrance to this chamber as the physician and Mickey converse offscreen. Dr. Abel momentarily crosses past the entrance. Appearing absorbed, Dr. Abel strides back into the consultation chamber, clutching Mickey's open dossier. He paces over to his bureau, exposing a terrified Mickey, seated in a chair opposite it. Still standing, the physician bends over the bureau, his back to the lens, and makes a few annotations in the dossier. Dr. Abel giggles as he shuts Mickey's dossier and straightens up. The camera gazes past his back and shoulders to the uneasy Mickey. Dr. Abel places his pen across Mickey's closed dossier. He ambles around his bureau and perches on its edge near Mickey. Mickey stands in a phone booth on a corner close to Dr. Abel's office; he converses on the telephone. It is drizzling. A male and a female clutching a parasol walk by; traffic progresses across a nearby crossroads. The film transitions to Dr. Wilkes, on the telephone at his end. He is in his office; he reclines back in his chair, dangling his stethoscope as he articulates. Behind him, a chest radiograph is mounted on a light panel. The movie shifts back and forth between Mickey in his phone booth inquiring and Dr. Wilkes in his office responding. Gail, wearing her spectacles, stands behind a congested but well-ordered bureau. Two aides, a male and a female, stand around her. The aides walk off. As they depart, Gail calls out after them. The telephone starts to ring, Gail pauses, looking offscreen. She removes her spectacles and squints. The film cuts to Mickey, who is pacing and wringing his hands. He moves over to Gail. He begins to pant, glancing anxiously around the chamber. He continues to wring his hands as Gail gazes at him, troubled. She sits down and picks up the telephone. Gail hangs up the telephone. He pants and begins to pace around the chamber. The camera tracks him as he walks away from Gail. Mickey sighs. Mickey begins pacing around the chamber again. He wrings his hands and blows on them. An abstract artwork on a wall fills the screen. Light chuckling is heard, as well as the sophisticated melody; offscreen brunch guests murmur indistinctly. Holly steps onto the screen in front of the artwork. She holds an almost vacant tray of hors d'oeuvres; she wears a uniform. One of the males, murmuring his gratitude, takes a final shrimp puff as Holly passes. Holly eventually makes her way into the cluttered loft kitchen. Her tray is vacant.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
As he walks, he engages in a conversation with the offscreen Mickey. Meanwhile, Dr. Abel makes his way offscreen into the second examining room. The camera remains steadily focused on the doorway leading to this room, capturing the ongoing conversation between the doctor and Mickey, who are both offscreen. Dr. Abel briefly appears in the doorway, looking somewhat preoccupied, before he returns to the consultation room, holding Mickey's open file in his hand. He strides purposefully over to his desk, revealing a frightened Mickey, who is seated in a chair directly opposite the desk. Still standing, the doctor leans over the desk, his back turned to the camera, and proceeds to make a few notes in the file. With a chuckle, Dr. Abel closes Mickey's file and straightens up. The camera captures the view past his back and shoulders, focusing on the anxious Mickey. Dr. Abel places his pen across the now-closed file belonging to Mickey. He then walks around his desk and perches on its edge, positioning himself close to Mickey. 

Mickey is now seen standing in a telephone booth situated on a corner near Dr. Abel's office; he is engaged in a phone conversation. It is raining outside. A man and a woman, sharing an umbrella, pass by as traffic moves steadily across a nearby intersection. The film transitions to Dr. Wilkes, who is on the telephone at his end. He is seated in his office, leaning back in his chair, casually dangling his stethoscope as he speaks. Behind him, a chest X-ray is prominently displayed on a light panel. The movie alternates between shots of Mickey in his phone booth, where he is asking questions, and Dr. Wilkes in his office, where he is providing answers.

Gail, wearing her glasses, stands behind a desk that is crowded yet well-organized. Two assistants, a man and a woman, are positioned around her. The assistants eventually walk off, and as they leave, Gail calls out after them. The telephone begins to ring, prompting Gail to pause and look offscreen. She removes her glasses and squints. The film then cuts to Mickey, who is pacing and wringing his hands nervously. He approaches Gail, panting and casting worried glances around the room. He continues to wring his hands as Gail, looking concerned, stares at him. She sits down and picks up the phone. After a moment, Gail hangs up the phone. Mickey continues to pant and begins pacing around the room once more. The camera follows his movements as he walks away from Gail. Mickey lets out a sigh. He resumes pacing around the room, wringing his hands and blowing on them to calm himself. 

An abstract painting on a wall fills the screen, accompanied by the sound of light laughter and sophisticated music; offscreen, brunch guests chatter indistinctly. Holly enters the screen, walking in front of the painting. She is holding an almost empty tray of hors d'oeuvres and is dressed in a uniform. One of the men, murmuring his thanks, takes a final shrimp puff as Holly passes by. Holly eventually makes her way into the cluttered loft kitchen, her tray now completely empty.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As he continues his walk, he finds himself engaged in an ongoing conversation with the unseen Mickey. Simultaneously, Dr. Abel makes his way offscreen, entering the second examining room with a sense of determination. The camera remains fixed and steadily focused on the doorway leading into the room, capturing the lively conversation taking place between the doctor and Mickey, who both remain out of sight. Dr. Abel briefly emerges in the doorway, appearing somewhat distracted and preoccupied, before he returns to the consultation room. He carries Mickey's open file in his hand, moving purposefully over to his desk, where a visibly frightened Mickey is seated in a chair directly opposite. Still standing, Dr. Abel leans over his desk, turning his back to the camera, and begins to jot down a few notes in the file. With a lighthearted chuckle, Dr. Abel finishes his notes, closes Mickey's file, and straightens up. The camera captures a view past the doctor's back and shoulders, focusing intently on the anxious Mickey. Dr. Abel then places his pen gently across the now-closed file belonging to Mickey. He then maneuvers around his desk and perches himself comfortably on its edge, positioning himself in close proximity to Mickey.

Mickey is now seen occupying a telephone booth situated on a street corner near Dr. Abel's office, engaged in an important phone conversation. Raindrops cascade down outside. A man and a woman, sharing the shelter of an umbrella, stroll by, while traffic flows steadily across the nearby intersection. The film transitions seamlessly to Dr. Wilkes, who is on the telephone at his end. He is relaxed, seated in his office chair, leaning back and casually dangling his stethoscope as he speaks. Behind him, a chest X-ray is prominently displayed on a light panel, drawing the eye. The movie alternates between vivid shots of Mickey in his phone booth, where he diligently asks questions, and Dr. Wilkes in his office, where he offers calm and measured answers.

Gail, poised and wearing her glasses, stands behind a desk that is both crowded with items and yet remains well-organized. Two assistants, one male and one female, are situated around her, helping manage the tasks. Eventually, the assistants walk off, leaving Gail to call out after them in an attempt to provide further instructions. The telephone suddenly starts to ring, causing Gail to pause momentarily and look offscreen. She removes her glasses and begins to squint. The film then cuts to Mickey, who is anxiously pacing and wringing his hands with nervous energy. He approaches Gail, panting slightly and casting worried glances around the room. He continues to wring his hands stressfully as Gail, looking visibly concerned, stares at him intently. She sits down and picks up the phone. After contemplating for a moment, Gail hangs up. Mickey continues to pant and resumes pacing around the room once more. The camera follows his every movement as he walks away from Gail. Mickey lets out a deep sigh. He resumes his restless pacing around the room, persistently wringing his hands and blowing on them in an attempt to calm himself down.

An abstract painting graces the screen, accompanied by the gentle sounds of light laughter and sophisticated music; offscreen, brunch guests chatter indistinctly, filling the atmosphere with a sense of lively leisure. Holly makes her entrance on screen, walking in front of the captivating painting. She is holding an almost empty tray of hors d'oeuvres and is dressed neatly in a uniform. One of the men, murmuring his thanks, takes a final shrimp puff as Holly passes by graciously. Holly eventually makes her way into the cluttered loft kitchen, her tray now completely devoid of its previous offerings.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As he walks, he engages in a conversation with the offscreen Mickey, his voice carrying through the air. Meanwhile, Dr. Abel moves out of view into the second examining room, leaving the camera to linger on the doorway, capturing the essence of the room as the doctor and Mickey continue their offscreen dialogue. Dr. Abel momentarily appears in the doorway, his expression one of deep thought, before he reenters the consultation room, now holding Mickey's open file in his hands. With purposeful strides, he approaches his desk, revealing a frightened Mickey seated in a chair opposite him. Remaining on his feet, Dr. Abel leans over the desk, his back turned to the camera, and begins to jot down a few notes in the file. A chuckle escapes him as he closes Mickey's file and straightens his posture. The camera's perspective shifts to look past his back and shoulders, focusing on the anxious Mickey. Dr. Abel places his pen across the closed file and then moves around his desk, choosing to sit on its edge, positioning himself close to Mickey. In a different scene, Mickey stands inside a telephone booth situated on a corner near Dr. Abel's office, speaking into the phone as rain falls around him. A man and a woman, sharing an umbrella, walk by, while traffic flows through a nearby intersection. The film transitions to Dr. Wilkes, who is on the phone at his end, comfortably leaning back in his chair, his stethoscope dangling as he converses. Behind him, a chest X-ray is prominently displayed on a light panel. The movie alternates between shots of Mickey in the phone booth, asking questions, and Dr. Wilkes in his office, providing answers. Meanwhile, Gail, wearing her glasses, stands behind a desk that is both crowded and well-organized. Two assistants, a man and a woman, are positioned around her, and as they depart, Gail calls out to them. The telephone begins to ring, prompting Gail to pause and look offscreen. She removes her glasses and squints, contemplating the situation. The scene shifts to Mickey, who is pacing and wringing his hands, his anxiety palpable. He approaches Gail, his breath quickening as he casts worried glances around the room. His hands continue to twist nervously as Gail observes him with concern. She takes a seat and picks up the phone, engaging in a brief conversation before hanging up. Mickey, still panting, resumes his pacing around the room, the camera tracking his movements as he distances himself from Gail. A sigh escapes him, and he begins to pace once more, his hands wringing and his breath visible as he blows on them. The screen fills with an abstract painting, accompanied by the sound of light laughter and sophisticated music, while offscreen brunch guests engage in indistinct chatter. Holly enters the frame in front of the painting, carrying an almost empty tray of hors d'oeuvres, her uniform marking her role. As she passes, one of the men murmurs his thanks and takes the last shrimp puff. Holly eventually makes her way into the cluttered loft kitchen, her tray now empty.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: He converses with the offscreen Mickey while walking, as Dr. Abel moves offscreen in the second examining room. The camera remains focused on the doorway as the doctor and Mickey continue their offscreen discussion. Dr. Abel briefly appears in the doorway, then returns to the consultation room, looking preoccupied and holding Mickey's open file. He approaches his desk, revealing a frightened Mickey seated opposite. Standing, Dr. Abel leans over the desk, makes notes in the file, chuckles, and closes it. The camera captures Mickey's anxious expression as Dr. Abel places his pen on the closed file, walks around the desk, and sits on its edge near Mickey. Meanwhile, Mickey stands in a telephone booth near Dr. Abel's office, talking on the phone in the rain. A couple with an umbrella passes by, and traffic moves through a nearby intersection. The scene alternates between Mickey in the booth asking questions and Dr. Wilkes in his office answering them, leaning back in his chair with a dangling stethoscope and a chest X-ray behind him. Gail, wearing glasses, stands behind a crowded but organized desk with two assistants, who leave as she calls after them. The phone rings, and Gail pauses, removes her glasses, and squints. The scene shifts to Mickey pacing and wringing his hands, then approaching Gail, panting and looking worried. Gail, concerned, sits down and answers the phone, then hangs up as Mickey continues pacing, sighing, and wringing his hands. An abstract painting fills the screen, accompanied by light laughter, sophisticated music, and indistinct chatter from offscreen brunch guests. Holly enters the scene in front of the painting, wearing a uniform and carrying an almost empty tray of hors d'oeuvres. A man murmurs his thanks as he takes the last shrimp puff, and Holly proceeds into the cluttered loft kitchen with her empty tray.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He talks to the offscreen Mickey, who is known for his anxious demeanor, as he walks. Dr. Abel, a renowned physician with a specialty in neurology, moves offscreen in the second examining room. The camera stays focused on the doorway to this room as the doctor and Mickey talk offscreen. Dr. Abel, who has worked at the St. Vincent Hospital for over a decade, briefly passes by the doorway. Looking preoccupied, Dr. Abel walks back into the consultation room, holding Mickey's open file, which details his medical history. He strides over to his desk, revealing a frightened Mickey, sitting in a chair opposite it. Still standing, the doctor leans over the desk, his back to the camera, and makes a few notes in the file. Dr. Abel, who is known for his reassuring demeanor, chuckles as he closes Mickey's file and straightens up. The camera looks past his back and shoulders to the anxious Mickey, whose eyes dart around nervously. Dr. Abel lays his pen, a gift from his mentor, across Mickey's closed file. He walks around his desk and sits on its edge close to Mickey. Mickey, who has just received unsettling news, stands in a telephone booth on a corner near Dr. Abel's office; he talks on the phone. It is raining heavily, one of the many unexpected showers in this coastal town. A man and a woman holding a vintage umbrella pass by; traffic moves across a nearby intersection famous for its bustling cafes. The film cuts to Dr. Wilkes, an old colleague of Dr. Abel, on the telephone at his end. He is in his office, decorated with accolades; he leans back in his chair, dangling his stethoscope as he speaks. Behind him, a chest X-ray is mounted on a light panel, a common diagnostic tool. The movie cuts back and forth between Mickey in his phone booth asking questions and Dr. Wilkes in his office answering them. Gail, wearing her glasses, stands behind a crowded but well-ordered desk strewn with files and medical journals. Two assistants, a man and a woman, stand around her, sorting through paperwork. The assistants, integral to the smooth operation of the office, walk off. As they leave, Gail calls out after them with a reminder about a meeting. The telephone starts to ring, Gail pauses, looking offscreen, considering whether to answer it. She takes off her glasses and squints at the tiny print on a chart. The film cuts to Mickey, who is pacing and wringing his hands, a habit he's had since childhood. He walks over to Gail, hoping for some reassurance. He starts to pant, looking worriedly around the room filled with medical staff. He continues to wring his hands as Gail stares at him, concerned about his state. She sits down and picks up the phone, dialing quickly. Gail hangs up the phone after leaving a message. He pants and begins to pace around the room, a sign of his mounting anxiety. The camera follows him as he walks away from Gail. Mickey sighs deeply, feeling overwhelmed by the situation. Mickey begins pacing around the room again, his mind racing with thoughts. He wrings his hands and blows on them, attempting to calm his nerves. An abstract painting on a wall, created by a local artist, fills the screen. Light laughter is heard, as well as the sophisticated music from a grand piano; offscreen brunch guests chatter indistinctly in the background. Holly, a young server working her way through college, walks onto the screen in front of the painting. She holds an almost empty tray of hors d'oeuvres; she wears a uniform typical of catering staff at upscale events. One of the men, murmuring his thanks, takes a last shrimp puff as Holly passes, appreciating the delicacy. Holly finally makes her way into the cluttered loft kitchen, bustling with activity. Her tray is empty, a sign of the lively gathering happening just outside.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: He talks to the offscreen Mickey as he walks. Dr Abel moves offscreen in the second examining room. The camera stays focused on the doorway to this room as the doctor and Mickey talk offscreen. Dr Abel briefly passes by the doorway. Looking preoccupied Dr Abel walks back into the consultation room holding Mickey's open file. He strides over to his desk revealing a frightened Mickey sitting in a chair opposite it. Still standing the doctor leans over the desk his back to the camera and makes a few notes in the file. Dr Abel chuckles as he closes Mickey's file and straightens up. The camera looks past his back and shoulders to the anxious Mickey. Dr Abel lays his pen across Mickey's closed file. He walks around his desk and sits on its edge close to Mickey. Mickey stands in a telephone booth on a corner near Dr Abel's office. he talks on the phone. It is raining. A man and a woman holding an umbrella pass by traffic moves across a nearby intersection. The film cuts to Dr Wilkes on the telephone at his end. He is in his office. he leans back in his chair dangling his stethoscope as he speaks. Behind him a chest Xray is mounted on a light panel. The movie cuts back and forth between Mickey in his phone booth asking questions and Dr Wilkes in his office answering them. Gail wearing her glasses stands behind a crowded but wellordered desk. Two assistants a man and a woman stand around her. The assistants walk off. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. As they leave Gail calls out after them. The telephone starts to ring. Gail pauses looking offscreen. She takes off her glasses and squints. The film cuts to Mickey who is pacing and wringing his hands. He walks over to Gail. He starts to pant looking worriedly around the room. He continues to wring his hands as Gail stares at him concerned. She sits down and picks up the phone. Gail hangs up the phone. He pants and begins to pace around the room. The camera follows him as he walks away from Gail. Mickey sighs. Mickey begins pacing around the room again. He wrings his hands and blows on them. An abstract painting on a wall fills the screen. Light laughter is heard as well as the sophisticated music. offscreen brunch guests chatter indistinctly. Holly walks onto the screen in front of the painting. She holds an almost empty tray of hors d'oeuvres. she wears a uniform. One of the men murmuring his thanks takes a last shrimp puff as Holly passes. Holly finally makes her way into the cluttered loft kitchen. Her tray is empty.

The owl is in its office; it leans back in its chair, dangling its stethoscope as it speaks. Behind the owl, a chest X-ray is mounted on a light panel. The movie cuts back and forth between the giraffe in its phone booth asking questions and the owl in its office answering them. The hummingbird, wearing her glasses, stands behind a crowded but well-ordered desk. Two dolphins, a dog and a cat, stand around her. The dolphins walk off. As they leave, the hummingbird calls out after them. The telephone starts to ring, the hummingbird pauses, looking offscreen. She takes off her glasses and squints. The film cuts to the giraffe, who is pacing and wringing its hands. The giraffe walks over to the hummingbird. The giraffe starts to pant, looking worriedly around the room. The giraffe continues to wring its hands as the hummingbird stares at it, concerned. She sits down and picks up the phone. The hummingbird hangs up the phone. The giraffe pants and begins to pace around the room. The camera follows the giraffe as it walks away from the hummingbird. The giraffe sighs. The giraffe begins pacing around the room again. It wrings its hands and blows on them. An abstract painting on a wall fills the screen. Light laughter is heard, as well as the sophisticated music; offscreen brunch guests chatter indistinctly. The zebra walks onto the screen in front of the painting. The zebra holds an almost empty tray of hors d'oeuvres; she wears a uniform. One of the rabbits, murmuring their thanks, takes a last shrimp puff as the zebra passes. The zebra finally makes her way into the cluttered loft kitchen. Her tray is empty.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: He talks to the offscreen Jimmy as he walks. Dr. Abel moves offscreen in the second counseling room. The camera stays focused on the doorway to this room as the doctor and Jimmy talk offscreen. Dr. Abel briefly passes by the doorway. Looking preoccupied, Dr. Abel walks back into the waiting area, holding Jimmy's open folder. He strides over to his cabinet, revealing a frightened Jimmy, sitting on a stool opposite it. Still standing, the doctor leans over the cabinet, his back to the camera, and makes a few notes in the folder. Dr. Abel chuckles as he closes Jimmy's folder and straightens up. The camera looks past his back and shoulders to the anxious Jimmy. Dr. Abel lays his pencil across Jimmy's closed folder. He walks around his cabinet and sits on its edge close to Jimmy. Jimmy stands in a fruit stand on a corner near Dr. Abel's office; he talks on the phone. It is snowing. A man and a woman holding a parasol pass by; bicycles move across a nearby intersection. The film cuts to Dr. Wilkes, on the telephone at his end. He is in his study; he leans back in his armchair, dangling his reading glasses as he speaks. Behind him, a heart diagram is mounted on a bulletin board. The movie cuts back and forth between Jimmy in his fruit stand asking questions and Dr. Wilkes in his study answering them. Gail, wearing her earrings, stands behind a crowded but well-ordered counter. Two assistants, a man and a woman, stand around her. The assistants walk off. As they leave, Gail calls out after them. The doorbell starts to chime, Gail pauses, looking offscreen. She takes off her earrings and squints. The film cuts to Jimmy, who is pacing and wringing his hands. He walks over to Gail. He starts to shiver, looking worriedly around the room. He continues to wring his hands as Gail stares at him, concerned. She sits down and picks up the phone. Gail hangs up the phone. He shivers and begins to pace around the room. The camera follows him as he walks away from Gail. Jimmy sighs. Jimmy begins pacing around the room again. He wrings his hands and blows on them. A modern sculpture in a corner fills the screen. Light laughter is heard, as well as the sophisticated music; offscreen evening guests chatter indistinctly. Holly walks onto the screen in front of the sculpture. She holds an almost empty basket of pastries; she wears an outfit. One of the men, murmuring his thanks, takes a last mini quiche as Holly passes. Holly finally makes her way into the cluttered loft pantry. Her basket is empty.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He whispers to the offscreen Mickey as he dances. Dr. Abel disappears offscreen in the second examining room. The camera lingers on the doorway to this room as the doctor and Mickey whisper offscreen. Dr. Abel swiftly glides by the doorway. Looking distracted, Dr. Abel skips back into the consultation room, clutching Mickey's open file. He marches over to his desk, exposing a nervous Mickey, perched in a chair opposite it. Still standing, the doctor bows over the desk, his back to the camera, and doodles a few sketches in the file. Dr. Abel giggles as he slams Mickey's file and stretches up. The camera peers past his back and shoulders to the anxious Mickey. Dr. Abel tosses his pen across Mickey's closed file. He prances around his desk and perches on its edge close to Mickey. Mickey leans in a telephone booth on a corner near Dr. Abel's office; he sings on the phone. It is raining. A man and a woman juggling an umbrella jog by; traffic dances across a nearby intersection. The film jumps to Dr. Wilkes, humming into the telephone at his end. He is in his office; he reclines in his chair, juggling his stethoscope as he sings. Behind him, a chest X-ray is scribbled on a light panel. The movie flips back and forth between Mickey in his phone booth singing questions and Dr. Wilkes in his office humming answers. Gail, donning her glasses, perches behind a crowded but well-ordered desk. Two assistants, a man and a woman, hover around her. The assistants twirl off. As they drift away, Gail whispers after them. The telephone starts to buzz, Gail freezes, gazing offscreen. She removes her glasses and blinks. The film jumps to Mickey, who is hopping and snapping his fingers. He skips over to Gail. He starts to whistle, glancing nervously around the room. He continues to snap his fingers as Gail observes him, puzzled. She plops down and lifts the phone. Gail places down the phone. He whistles and begins to hop around the room. The camera trails him as he prances away from Gail. Mickey groans. Mickey resumes hopping around the room. He snaps his fingers and blows on them. An abstract painting on a wall dominates the screen. Gentle giggles are heard, as well as elegant music; offscreen brunch guests murmur indistinctly. Holly glides onto the screen in front of the painting. She grips an almost empty tray of hors d'oeuvres; she dons a uniform. One of the men, humming his gratitude, nabs a final shrimp puff as Holly skips past. Holly eventually waltzes into the cluttered loft kitchen. Her tray is bare.

Looking preoccupied, Captain Sparrow walks back into the cafeteria, holding the mountain's open umbrella. It strides over to its piano, revealing a frightened mountain, sitting in a chair opposite it. Still standing, the wizard leans over the piano, its back to the bicycle, and makes a few notes in the umbrella. Captain Sparrow chuckles as it closes the mountain's umbrella and straightens up. It is in its garden; it leans back in its chair, dangling its telescope as it speaks. Behind it, a piano sonata is mounted on a breeze. The movie cuts back and forth between the mountain in its birdcage asking riddles and Captain Jack in its garden answering them. The saxophone starts to hum, Gingerbread pauses, looking offscreen. It takes off its headphones and squints. The film cuts to the mountain, who is pacing and wringing its hands. It walks over to Gingerbread. It starts to jog, looking worriedly around the garden. It continues to wring its hands as Gingerbread stares at it, concerned. It sits down and picks up the saxophone. Gingerbread hangs up the saxophone. It jogs and begins to pace around the garden. The bicycle follows it as it walks away from Gingerbread. The mountain sighs. The mountain begins pacing around the garden again. It wrings its hands and blows on them. A puzzle piece on a window fills the screen. Soft humming is heard, as well as the energetic drumming; offscreen wedding guests chatter indistinctly. Maple walks onto the screen in front of the puzzle piece. test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He whispers to the offscreen clown as he skips. Professor Barkley sneaks offscreen in the second library room. The camera remains focused on the archway to this room as the professor and clown whisper offscreen. Professor Barkley momentarily glides by the archway. Looking distracted, Professor Barkley skips back into the study room, clutching the clown's open binder. He marches over to his bookshelf, revealing a startled clown, sitting on a stool opposite it. Remaining standing, the professor bends over the table, his back to the camera, and sketches a few doodles in the binder. Professor Barkley giggles as he shuts the clown's binder and straightens up. The camera gazes past his back and shoulders to the jittery clown. Professor Barkley places his pencil across the clown's closed binder. He dances around his bookshelf and perches on its corner close to the clown. The clown stands in a newspaper stand on a corner near Professor Barkley's study; he discusses on the phone. It is drizzling. A sailor and a nurse holding a parasol stroll by; bicycles roll across a nearby junction. The film transitions to Dr. Jessup, on the video call at his end. He is in his studio; he reclines in his armchair, twirling his magnifying glass as he converses. Behind him, a weather map is pinned on a bulletin board. The movie switches back and forth between the clown in his newspaper stand posing inquiries and Dr. Jessup in his studio responding. Paula, wearing her scarf, stands behind a crowded but well-organized workbench. Two interns, a chef and a pilot, stand around her. The interns jog off. As they depart, Paula shouts after them. The clock starts to chime, Paula hesitates, staring offscreen. She removes her scarf and squints. The film cuts to the clown, who is jogging and clenching his fists. He strolls over to Paula. He starts to gasp, glancing apprehensively around the room. He continues to clench his fists as Paula glances at him, worried. She settles down and grabs the clock. Paula places down the clock. He gasps and starts to jog around the room. The camera tracks him as he strolls away from Paula. The clown exhales. The clown begins jogging around the room again. He clenches his fists and blows on them. An abstract sculpture on a pedestal fills the screen. Gentle murmuring is heard, as well as the elegant music; offscreen gallery visitors murmur indistinctly. Lucy strolls onto the screen in front of the sculpture. She balances an almost empty platter of canapés; she wears an apron. One of the poets, whispering his gratitude, takes a final cheese tart as Lucy strolls by. Lucy finally makes her way into the disorganized studio kitchen. Her platter is empty.

The camera peers past his back and shoulders to the nervous Teddy. Dr. Abel places his pencil across Teddy's closed notebook. He strolls around his table and perches on its edge near Teddy. The movie alternates between Teddy in his bus stop shelter asking riddles and Dr. Wilkes in his study solving them. Gail, wearing her monocle, stands behind a cluttered but logically arranged table. Two colleagues, a boy and a girl, hover around her. The colleagues drift off. As they wander away, Gail shouts after them. The walkie-talkie begins to chime, Gail hesitates, peering offscreen. She removes her monocle and blinks. The film cuts to Teddy, who is fidgeting and tapping his feet. He dances over to Gail. He starts to puff, glancing nervously around the chamber. He continues to tap his feet as Gail gazes at him, worried. She reclines and lifts up a walkie-talkie. Gail sets down the walkie-talkie. He puffs and begins to twist around the chamber. The camera trails him as he dances away from Gail. Teddy exhales. Teddy begins twisting around the chamber again. He taps his feet and whistles on them. An abstract sculpture in the corner fills the screen. Soft giggles are heard, as well as the elegant music; offscreen brunch attendees mumble indistinctly. Holly strides onto the screen in front of the sculpture. She carries an almost empty bucket of punch; she wears overalls. One of the women, muttering her gratitude, takes a final cucumber sandwich as Holly ambles by. Holly eventually makes her way into the disorganized attic pantry. Her bucket is empty.

The spotlight remains directed at the archway to this room as the chef and Pluto whisper offscreen. Professor Bane momentarily glides by the archway. Looking distracted, Professor Bane twirls back into the laboratory, clutching Pluto's sealed envelope. He prances over to his counter, revealing a nervous Pluto, reclining in a hammock opposite it. Still hovering, the chef arches over the counter, his back to the spotlight, and scribbles a few doodles in the envelope. Professor Bane giggles as he seals Pluto's envelope and stretches up. The spotlight peers past his back and elbows to the jittery Pluto. Professor Bane drapes his pencil across Pluto's sealed envelope. He twirls around his counter and perches on its rim close to Pluto. Pluto stands in a flower shop on a junction near Professor Bane's garage; it whispers on the radio. It is snowing. A child and an elderly person clutching a raincoat saunter by; bicycles glide across a nearby roundabout. The video cuts to Professor Snape, on the radio at his side. He is in his garage; he relaxes back in his sofa, juggling his microscope as he chats. Behind him, a butterfly specimen is pinned on a cork board. The animation cuts back and forth between Pluto in its flower shop probing riddles and Professor Snape in his garage responding to them. Claire, wearing her spectacles, waves behind a messy but neatly arranged bookshelf. Two interns, a child and an elderly person, lounge around her. The interns wander off. As they disappear, Claire shouts out after them. The radio begins to hum, Claire freezes, looking offscreen. She removes her spectacles and grimaces. The animation cuts to Pluto, who is twirling and clenching its paws. It skips over to Claire. It begins to puff, gazing nervously around the attic. It continues to clench its paws as Claire gawks at it, worried. She reclines and turns on the radio. Claire shuts off the radio. It puffs and begins to skip around the attic. The spotlight tracks it as it skips away from Claire. Pluto groans. Pluto begins skipping around the attic again. It clenches its paws and whistles on them. An abstract sculpture on a shelf fills the frame. Faint chuckles are heard, as well as the elegant jazz; offscreen dinner attendees murmur vaguely. Ivy prances onto the frame in front of the sculpture. She clutches an almost vacant basket of cookies; she wears a costume. One of the children, whispering his appreciation, takes a final cucumber sandwich as Ivy glides by. Ivy eventually tiptoes her way into the chaotic studio pantry. Her basket is vacant.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Dr. Abel talks to Mickey offscreen as he moves through a second examining room. The camera focuses on the room's doorway while they converse. Dr. Abel, appearing preoccupied, returns with Mickey's file and makes notes at his desk. He chuckles, closes the file, and sits close to an anxious Mickey. Meanwhile, Mickey stands in a phone booth by Dr. Abel's office in the rain, speaking on the phone. Traffic moves, and a couple with an umbrella passes by. The scene shifts to Dr. Wilkes, who speaks on the phone with Mickey. Behind him, a chest X-ray is displayed. The film alternates between Mickey's questions and Dr. Wilkes' answers. Gail, with two assistants, stands behind a busy desk. After the assistants leave, Gail takes a phone call, watching Mickey who paces, worriedly wringing his hands. After the call, Mickey sighs and continues pacing. An abstract painting fills the screen, accompanied by laughter and music. Holly, in a uniform, passes with a tray of hors d'oeuvres, delivers the last to a guest, then enters the kitchen with an empty tray.
